wikipedia_page.main: Alan Scotthorne  of England is the first angler to win five individual World Freshwater Angling Championships, (1996, 1997, 1998, 2003, 2007), has won the "team" world championships with "England" on eight occasions between 1994 and 2013, making him the most successful international angler in history.

response: He has been individual World Champion on a record 4 occasions, making him the most successful international angler ever at the time, later surpassed by England teammate Alan Scotthorne. Nudd's world titles were won at the following tournaments:
* Alan Scotthorne. For services to Angling.
| 1996 || Peschiera del Garda, Italy ||  Alan Scotthorne ||  C Guicciardi ||  E Colombo ||
| 1997 || Velence, Hungary ||  Alan Scotthorne ||  Gianluigi Sorti ||  K Milson ||
| 1998 || Zagreb, Croatia ||  Alan Scotthorne ||  P Carroyer ||  M Barros ||
| 2003 || Madunice, Slovakia ||  Alan Scotthorne ||  K Schater ||  R Bednarski ||
| 2007 || Lake Velence, Hungary ||  Alan Scotthorne ||  N. Gavrobiks ||  Lee Edwards ||
| 2013 || Żerański Canal, Warsaw, Poland ||  Didier Delannoy ||  Steve Hemmingway ||  Alan Scotthorne ||
| 2015 || Sava River,  Slovenia ||  Yuri Siptsov ||  Walter Tamás ||  Alan Scotthorne ||
| Individual multiple Champions :   Alan Scotthorne  5,  Bob Nudd 4,  Tesse 3,   Fougeat 2,  Kremkus 2,   Bassi 2,  Tamas Walter 2,  Goran Radovic 2
